description: In Spring Framework, managing beans effectively is crucial for building robust and maintainable applications. The Spring Bean Lifecycle is a key concept that helps developers understand how beans are created, initialized, and destroyed within a Spring container.
title: What is the Spring Bean Lifecycle?

description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) is one of the most prevalent security vulnerabilities in web applications. It occurs when an attacker injects malicious scripts into content that users can view on a web page. These scripts can steal data, hijack user sessions, or perform other harmful actions.
title: 4 Ways to Prevent XSS Attacks: A Comprehensive Guide
